result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald Dushon Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Reginald Dushon Moore was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reginald Dushon Moore is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Reginald Dushon Moore was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Reginald Dushon Moore was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Attempt to Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA  surcharge out of up to 25% of prison wges. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*4/20/2016  Honorable William S. Pocan signed Order: DNA surcharge vacated on count two.

Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one half (1/2) Initial Confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 40 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time emloyment.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include those as listed.
conditions apply to both counts/case.

Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated. Order received and filed.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for zero days.

amended per DNA surcharge count two vacated.

Decision and Order Partially Granting Motion for Postconviction Relief, filed and signed by the Court.  The DNA surcharge on count two is vacated; the defendant remains responsible for the single DNA surcharge on count one.  The judgment shall be amended accordingly.  The defendant's request to modify his sentence to remove cognitive therapy requirement from the conditions of extended supervision is denied.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. spc

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  COUNT 1:    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and Defense.  Additional statement by Angela B.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 40 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

 - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving **1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COUNT 2:   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and Defense.  Additional statement by Angela B.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

 - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving **1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

** Defendant qualifies for WSAP after serving 1 year of initial confinement.

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.   At the hour of 10:00 a.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND NOT GUILTY AS TO COUNT 3 which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  

Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgments on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgments not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction on COUNTS 1 AND 2 and grants defense motion for acquittal on COUNT 3.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court will retain file for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    Trial continued. Sidebar conversation put on the record. Jury in box at 9:57 a.m.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:58 a.m to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Learanth and Ford who were duly sworn for that purpose.

-CASE RECALLED AT 1:20 P.M. 
-SAME APPEARANCES
Sidebar conversations put on the record along with jury questions to be marked as exhibit #'s A & B.

-CASE RECALLED AT 2:56 P.M.
-Paul Hauer for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Jury questions put on the record to be marked as exhibit #'s C & D.

-CASE RECALLED AT 4:29 P.M.
-Paul Hauer for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
-JURY IN BOX AT 4:36 P.M.
For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial /deliberatios in Branch 26 on July 28, 2014 at 8:45 a.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    Trial continued.  Jury in box at 1:38 p.m. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Molina. Jury out box at 1:54 p.m. Sidebar conversation put on the record. Jury in box at 2:02 p.m. Court strikes last question asked of City of Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Molina still under oath.  Sworn for the state: Crime Laboratory Expert Birjees Kauser. Exhibit #'s 9B and 12 offered and received. Re-sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Christopher Conway. Exhibit #5A was not offered and received. State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 2:39 p.m. Sidebar conversation put on the record. Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box at 3:08 p.m. Sworn for defense: Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore. Sidebar conversation.  Court strikes last question asked of defendant Reginald Dushon Moore. Exhibit # 13 offered and received. Sidebar conversation. Defense rests. Exhibit # 5A offered and received. Jury out of box at 4:01 p.m. Sidebar conversation put on the record. Jury in box at 4:25 p.m. Sworn for state as rebuttal witnesses: City of Milwaukee Police Officer's Michael Martin and Christopher Conway. Exhibit #14 offered and received.  State and defense rest. Testimony closed. Sidebar conversation. Jury excused for the evening at 4:39 p.m. Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 26 on July 25, 2014 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Trial continued. Jury in box at 9:55 a.m. City of Milwaukee Police Officer Michael Martin still under oath for the state: Partial sidebar conversation put on the record. Exhibit #'s 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 10, & 11 offered and received. Jury out of box at 10:42 a.m. Continuation of sidebar converstation put on the record.Jury in box at 11:04 a.m. City of Milwaukee Police Officer Michael Martin still under oath for the state. Exhibit # 6 offered and received, defense objects.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Christopher Conway. Exhibit #'s 8, 9A offered and received. Court withholds decision on exhibit #9B. Jury excused for lunch at 11:50 a.m., Court ordered case adjourned for continued jury trial in Branch 26 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:30 p.m.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Michael Martin, MPD.  Due to the late hour, case adjourned.  Jury trial scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 4 on the Amended Information DISMISSED without prejudice.  ON ORAL MOTION OF THE STATE, COUNT 3  IS AMENDED TO REFLECT 'OBSTRUCTING' INSTEAD OF 'RESISTING'.  Case passed for the lunch hour.

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).  Final pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7-23-14, 9:00 a.m.
Filed by the State:  Requested Jury Instruction, Motion in Limine, Witness List.  alp

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L Cubbie.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn for the State:  1). Officer Michael Martin (MPD). Exhibits 1, 2, and 3 offered, marked, and received into evidence.  State rest subject to rebuttal. Sworn for Defense:  1) Defendant, Reginal Dushon Moore. Defense and State rest. Closing arguments by State and Defense. Court DENIED the Motion to Suppress.  Case adjourned for a Jury Trial and Final Pretrial in Branch 26. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order received, signed and filed with court.  Jury Trial scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final Pre-trial scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L Cubbie.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 26.  Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Rodney L Cubbie.  Step Nolten for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Michael Martin.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-24-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant states he plans to hire a private attorney

Defendant Reginald Dushon Moore in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
